text: The Institut national de l'image et du son (INIS) National Institute College of Image and Sound is a training institute for film, television and interactive media creation located in Montreal, Quebec. The institute was incorporated as a non-profit organization in 1990 and began operations in 1996. INIS is located adjacent to the Cinémathèque québécoise. As of 2002, its operating budget was reported to be $3.2 million, with half supplied by the film industry and half from the Quebec and Canadian governments. It was founded by Quebec filmmaker Fernand Dansereau. ==References== ==External links== *School website Category:Universities and colleges in Montreal Category:Cinema of Quebec Category:Film schools in Canada Category:Educational institutions established in 1990 Category:Private colleges in Quebec Category:Culture of Montreal Category:Ville-Marie, Montreal
title: Institut national de l'image et du son
